column5: AUPH After a quick once overit seems that ILJIN has let the price action effect their emotions as weve seen here with many retail investors over the monthsyears So much of what they seem angry about is PPSif theyre planning on holding for the long haul what does todays price really matter I will have to reread laterbut this feels like a temper tantrum over price action while throwing in a sidenote that someone is being paid too much

AUPH I am back on the fence Iljin definitely has skin in the game and is not trying wrestle control away from current managementIt also appears that Iljin wants to commercialize VOC does that mean that AUPH is playing for a BOI have a lot more reading to do
AUPH The reason the stock price action sucks is because we keep diluting Stop raising money and up we go
AUPH reads as if ILJIN is the one who wants to commercialize
AUPH this is great stuff folksread both arguments and digest it allhopefully more to come

AUPH well they went nuclear Have never seen something like this We need a white knight ASAP Get this thing sold They articulated their grievances in great detail with a lot of red meat Board needs to provide their POV ASAP This in due course nonsense is not enough
AUPH Just now hit my trading platform BioTech news AUPH 4 separate articles Holy crap

AUPH We had originally proposed four 4 nominees under Aurinias advance notice bylaw to preserve our ability to be responsive to Aurinias circular once released as we did not know at the time at what size the board would be fixed and the advance notice bylaw is inflexible on the ability to later add nominees Now that Aurinia has definitively proposed to fix the number of directors at eight 8 we are proposing a minority slate of three 3 directors for appointment which is consistent with our message Further one of our nominees is proposed to be appointed in lieu of our current representative on the board of directors Dr Hyuek Joon Lee Iljin just pulled the rug out from under AUPHs main argument for voting for current management

AUPH Developing a longterm strategy as a standalone pharmaceutical company including fully pursuing Aurinias current and future alternative applications of voclosporin and to move market perception away from a binary bet on the success of voclosporin in treating LN So is Iljin the one who is wanting to turn this into a full blown pharma company Is anyone else reading this part like that
AUPH I think Ill print and go over this thing with a fine tooth comb but man theyre in serious conflict with current mgmt or its just worded to sound that way

AUPH My only issue w Glick was he was way too subdued and lacked real passion to the street and investors I dont want a used car salesman approach either Guy is brilliant and extremely ethical but not the guy you want as the face of a late stage clinical bio He needs to be behind the scenes making most of the critical business decisions
AUPH beginning of their letter its looong
AUPH Thank you SteveTexans for precisely wording the current state of affairs ILJIN is acting in the best interest for ILJIN and AUPH board is acting in the best interest for Shareholders
AUPH ILJIN letter to shareholders has been filed Im reading on ETrade website
AUPH Very simple ILJIN is acting in the best interest for ILJIN and AUPH board is acting in the best interest for Shareholders
AUPH voting green
AUPH Commercial Potential of Voclosporin is TremendousYea i know thats why i own this just like you

AUPH since announcing positive longterm outcomes for patients suffering from LN followed by a significant public offering of stock in March 2017 Aurinia has failed to communicate or execute a coherent strategy to maintain its momentum and to realize the tremendous potential of voclosporin Shareholders ILJIN included are losing confidence in a board of directors and management team whose interests are increasingly at odds with shareholders as reflected in rising executive compensation minimal stock ownership and an egregious lack of independence There can be no other explanation for the fact that Aurinias share price has failed to move materially over the past two years

AUPH Straight from ILJIN mouth To date we have invested 58 million in Aurinia and the future of voclosporin Added Kim We along with all Aurinia shareholders have waited patiently for current leadership to not only advance the commercialization of voclosporin but to do so in a way that shows respect for its public shareholders in terms of financial discipline proper corporate governance and prudent capital raising Unfortunately the current Board has repeatedly failed to meet these responsibilities and change is needed This is a critical time for the Corporation and the Boards leadership will determine if and how value is realized at Aurinia So far this Board has focused primarily on itself not the interests of shareholders We urge shareholders to join us in electing three new independent directors and return control of Aurinias future to all of its shareholders not Aurinia insiders
